title: 0.1 M solution with greatest conductivity and why

content.question: Of the three solutions listed in the table, which one, if any, has the greatest electrical conductivity and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.1 molar H C 2 H 3 O 2, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> because its molecules have the most atoms.

<math alttext="0.1 molar K I, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>KI</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="K I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> completely dissociates in water to produce ions.

<math alttext="0.1 molar C H 3 O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> because its molecules can form hydrogen bonds.
All three solutions have the same electrical conductivity because the concentrations are the same.

content.answer: <math alttext="0.1 molar K I, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>KI</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="K I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> completely dissociates in water to produce ions.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
